articles.description:
The North Korea-linked threat actor known as Kimsuky (aka Black Banshee, Emerald Sleet, or Springtail) has been observed shifting its tactics, leveraging Compiled HTML Help (CHM) files as vectors to deliver malware for harvesting sensitive data.
Kimsuky, active since at least 2012, is known to target entities located in South Korea as well as North America, Asia, and Europe.

articles.title: N. Korea-linked Kimsuky Shifts to Compiled HTML Help Files in Ongoing Cyberattacks

articles.description:

articles.title: German Police Seize 'Nemesis Market' in Major International Darknet Raid

articles.title: Russian Hackers Use 'WINELOADER' Malware to Target German Political Parties

articles.description:

articles.title: New StrelaStealer Phishing Attacks Hit Over 100 Organizations in E.U. and U.S.

articles.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have shared details of a now-patched security vulnerability in Amazon Web Services (AWS) Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA) that could be potentially exploited by a malicious actor to hijack victims' sessions and achieve remote code execution on underlying instances.
The vulnerability, now addressed by AWS, has been codenamed FlowFixation by Tenable.
articles.title: AWS Patches Critical 'FlowFixation' Bug in Airflow Service to Prevent Session Hijacking

articles.title: China-Linked Group Breaches Networks via Connectwise, F5 Software Flaws

articles.description:

articles.title: Massive Sign1 Campaign Infects 39,000+ WordPress Sites with Scam Redirects

articles.title: Implementing Zero Trust Controls for Compliance

articles.title: U.S. Justice Department Sues Apple Over Monopoly and Messaging Security

articles.title: Russia Hackers Using TinyTurla-NG to Breach European NGO's Systems

articles.title: Over 800 npm Packages Found with Discrepancies, 18 Exploitable to 'Manifest Confusion'

articles.title: AndroxGh0st Malware Targets Laravel Apps to Steal Cloud Credentials
